Package gov.sandia.geotess.extensions.rstt

Class LineScanner

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.geotess.extensions.rstt.LineScanner
public class LineScanner
extends java.lang.Object
A simple, yet fast, ascii file scanner that handles empty lines and lines with comments and lines with trailing comments.
Author:
jrhipp

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    LineScanner​(java.io.BufferedReader readerInput)
    Initialize a new LineScanner with input.
    LineScanner​(java.io.BufferedReader readerInput, java.lang.String cmntStr)
    Initialize a new LineScanner with input.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String getLastLine()
    Returns the last line read from input into the current lineScanner.
    boolean hasNext()
    Returns true if this LineScanner has more data.
    boolean nextBoolean()
    Returns the next token in lineScanner as a boolean.
    byte nextByte()
    Returns the next token in lineScanner as an byte.

    Returns the next token in lineScanner as a double.

    • hasNext

      public boolean hasNext() throws java.io.IOException
      Returns true if this LineScanner has more data.
      Returns:
      True if this LineScanner has more data.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • nextDouble

      public double nextDouble() throws java.io.IOException
      Returns the next token in lineScanner as a double. This method checks the current lineScanner instance for more input and creates a new instance with the next set of input if the current scanner is empty.
      Returns:
      The next scanner token as a double.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • nextFloat

      public float nextFloat() throws java.io.IOException

      Returns:
      The next scanner token as a float.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException
